intro: Matelea suberifera, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as bats and moths. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, while the stems are woody and branched. Matelea suberifera is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, moist environments.
